intro: Scabiosa schizantha, commonly known as the spring scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flower heads that resemble small, clustered blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and grasslands. Scabiosa schizantha is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
